title: Ukraine War Threatens Commodities Supply and Miners Can’t React
sub_head: Prolonged underinvestment in mines leaves companies unable to raise production to cover potential shortfalls in Russian exports
body:
ADELAIDE, Australia—Commodity prices are booming on fears of shortages as the West severs ties with resource-rich Russia, but there is little global miners can do to fill supply gaps soon.
That means materials used in products such as smartphones, air-conditioning units and autos are becoming more expensive, feeding an acceleration in inflation world-wide that has pushed up the cost of living. Prices of metals and minerals including coal, copper and nickel have surged to highs, as Russia’s invasion of Ukraine deepens concerns about supply shocks that could harm the global economic recovery from the pandemic.
